PDI551.name: General Pathology
PDI551.description: Host responses to injury, including cell degeneration, necrosis, disturbances of growth and development, neoplasia, circulatory disturbances, and inflammation.
PDI551.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

PDI553.name: Systemic Pathology
PDI553.description: Anatomic pathology of digestive, urinary, respiratory, integumentary, cardiovascular, nervous, reproductive, musculoskeletal, endocrine, and lymphatic systems.
PDI553.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

PDI554.name: Veterinary Clinical Pathology
PDI554.description: Collection and assessment of body fluids and tissue. Interpretation of test results. Pathophysiological basis for test abnormalities. Basic technical laboratory competencies.
PDI554.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

PDI560.name: Introduction to Veterinary Cytology
PDI560.description: Principles of sample collection, slide preparation, fluid analysis and interpretation using clinical case material.
PDI560.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

PDI561.name: International Veterinary Medicine
PDI561.description: Veterinary sciences and the needs of international countries.
PDI561.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

PDI562.name: Introduction to Emerging and Foreign Animal Diseases
PDI562.description: Emerging and exotic animal diseases, their recognition, diagnosis, and proper reporting.
PDI562.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

PDI564.name: Topographic and Applied Anatomy of Live Horses and Cattle
PDI564.description: Identification of structures and landmarks of clinical significance in live horses and cattle in relation to the structures imaged using endoscopy, ultrasonography, radiology, MRI, and CT scans.
PDI564.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

PDI590.name: Selective Topics in Pathobiology and Diagnostic Investigation
PDI590.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
PDI590.description: Important field of study in Pathobiology and Diagnostic Investigation.
PDI590.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

PDI610.name: Veterinary Gross Anatomy Dissection
PDI610.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PDI610.description: Dissection and prosection of selected regions of domestic animals.
PDI610.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

PDI611.name: Research Problems in Veterinary Anatomy
PDI611.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PDI611.description: Veterinary gross anatomy, cell biology, histology, or neurobiology.
PDI611.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

PDI630.name: Diagnostic Pathology Clerkship
PDI630.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
PDI630.description: Necropsy and clinical pathology techniques and interpretation of clinical findings, post mortem findings, and diagnostic laboratory results.
PDI630.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

PDI631.name: Necropsy Clerkship
PDI631.description: Supervised necropsy. Interpretation and presentation of findings.
PDI631.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

PDI632.name: Problems in Veterinary Pathology
PDI632.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PDI632.description: Supervised projects involving gross pathology, histopathology, clinical pathology, or molecular pathology.
PDI632.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

PDI633.name: Special Problems in Veterinary Pathology
PDI633.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PDI633.description: Supervised off-campus experience or project involving gross pathology, histopathology, ultrastructural pathology, clinical pathology, or molecular pathology. Experience may emphasize diagnostic pathology or research. Settings may include, but are not limited to other colleges of veterinary medicine, private industry, and governmental institutions.
PDI633.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

PDI634.name: Endocrinology Clerkship
PDI634.description: Principles of endocrinology and diagnosis of endocrinology disorders. Case review and interpretation.
PDI634.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

PDI635.name: Special Problems in Histopathology and Cytology Clerkship
PDI635.description: Study of the histopathology and clinical cytology of various diseases of veterinary importance.
PDI635.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

PDI636.name: Aquatic Animal Medicine Clerkship
PDI636.description: Clinical, laboratory, and ecological principles of disease of aquatic organisms with special emphasis on impacts and management. Critical analysis and review of selected case studies and disease control regimen.
PDI636.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

PDI637.name: Poultry Medicine Clerkship
PDI637.description: Diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of viral, bacterial, parasitic, fungal, and nutritional diseases of commercial poultry. Biosecurity principles, insect and rodent control, and the proper selection and use of disinfectants. Field trips required.
PDI637.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

PDI804.name: Molecular and Developmental Neurobiology
PDI804.description: Nervous system specific gene transcription and translation. Maturation, degeneration, plasticity, and repair in the nervous system.
PDI804.restrictions: Open to graduate students in Neuroscience major.

PDI816.name: Integrative Toxicology: Mechanisms, Pathology and Regulation
PDI816.description: Biochemical, molecular, and physiological mechanisms of toxicology. Functional and pathological responses of major organ systems to chemical insult. Mechanisms of mutagenesis, carcinogenesis, and reproductive toxicology. Concepts in risk and safety assessment.

PDI830.name: Concepts in Molecular Biology
PDI830.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
PDI830.description: Techniques and theories of molecular biology, nucleic acid synthesis and isolation, enzymatic digestion and modification, electrophoresis, hybridization, amplification, library construction, and cloning.

PDI851.name: Advanced General Pathology
PDI851.description: Fundamental concepts of cell injury, inflammation, and oncogenesis. Mechanisms of disease.

PDI853.name: Advanced Systemic Pathology
PDI853.description: Pathological aspects of the nervous, endocrine, cardiovascular, respiratory, urinary, genital, musculoskeletal, integumentary, and special sense systems.

PDI854.name: Advanced Clinical Pathology
PDI854.description: Interpretation and pathogenesis of veterinary clinical pathology laboratory abnormalities.

PDI870.name: Laboratory Animal Pathology
PDI870.description: Diseases and pathology of laboratory animal species including mice, rats, ferrets, rabbits, primates, and fish. Use of laboratory animals for toxicological pathology in industry.

PDI890.name: Problems in Veterinary Pathology
PDI890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PDI890.description: Faculty supervised work on an experimental, theoretical, or applied problem in veterinary pathology.

PDI891.name: Problems in Pathobiology
PDI891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PDI891.description: Faculty supervised work on an experimental, theoretical, or applied problem in pathobiology and diagnostic investigation.

PDI892.name: Pathology Seminar
PDI892.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
PDI892.description: Presentation and discussion of current topics in pathology by departmental graduate students, faculty, or outside speakers.

PDI893.name: Pathology Case Discussion Seminar
PDI893.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
PDI893.description: Utilization of a group of theme-based veterinary cases to train pathology residents and graduate students in diagnostic pathology.
PDI893.restrictions: Open to graduate students or lifelong graduate students in the Department of Pathobiology and Diagnostic Investigation. Approval of department.

PDI894.name: Diagnostic Histopathology of Neoplastic Diseases of Domestic Animals
PDI894.description: Histologic diagnosis of neoplastic diseases of domestic animals, including prognostic criteria, grading systems, and ancillary techniques to aid in diagnosis and prognosis.

PDI899.name: Master's Thesis Research
PDI899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PDI899.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Department of Pathobiology and Diagnostic Investigation. Approval of department.

PDI999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
PDI999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PDI999.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Department of Pathobiology and Diagnostic Investigation. Approval of department.
